transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Let me show you another bizarre comment.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: This is from a man called Patrick Christie.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: He calls himself a journalist and this is what he said.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Congratulations India on landing on the dark side of the moon.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: I would also like to now invite India to return the 2.3 billion pounds foreign aid money

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: that we sent them between 2016 and 2021.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: You shouldn't be coming to us with your hand out.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: If you're going down that road, let's start with reparations.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Let's start with the colonial loot.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Return that money first and we have the bill.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: Some 45 trillion dollars, that's what Britain looted from India between 1765 and 1938

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: and this is just an estimate the action figure could be much higher.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: But even this 45 trillion is about 15 times Britain's GDP.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_01
transcript.text: How about London returns this money first?
